drupalNodeEvent.title: DAU9: Higher Education and the Changing Global Order

field_speakers.processed:
Prof. Rafael L. REIF 
Immediate Past President·MIT
Prof. Rafael L. REIF is the immediate Past President of MIT from 2012 to 2022. Before that, he served as the Provost of the institute from 2005 to 2012. He sits on the boards of the World Economic Forum, the Carnegie Endowment, the Council on Foreign Relations, and the Broad Institute. He received his Ph.D. in electrical engineering from Stanford University.

Prof. SHI Yigong 施一公
Founding President·Westlake University 西湖大学创校校长
Prof. SHI Yigong is the Founding President of Westlake University, China's first private research university, and a leading figure in structural biology. Prior to his current role, he served as the Vice President of Tsinghua University. He received his Ph.D. in molecular biophysics from the Johns Hopkins University.

Prof. Tony F CHAN 陈繁昌
President·King Abdullah University of Science and Technology 阿卜杜拉国王科技大学校长，香港科技大学前校长
Prof. Tony F. CHAN became the President of the King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST) in 2018, after nearly a decade as president of The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST). He serves as a member of the Board of the Future Investment Initiative Institute; King Abdulaziz City of Science & Technology; the Biotechnology City Initiative of Riyadh among others. He received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from Caltech.

field_description.processed: In a period marked by historical technological shifts and geopolitical realignments, higher education stands at a critical crossroads fraught with both challenges and untapped opportunities. Is the traditional model of universities sustainable in this new global context? How are geopolitical tensions affecting academic collaborations? Join us for a unique dialogue featuring distinguished leaders in higher education from China, the United States, and Saudi Arabia. We'll delve into key topics such as the geopolitics affecting academic collaborations, the impact of new technologies, and the future of skills training. During the discussion, attendees will have the opportunity to pose their questions directly to the panelists.
